Package uno.anahata.asi.swing.chat.render

Class MarkupTextSegmentRenderer

java.lang.Object
uno.anahata.asi.swing.chat.render.AbstractTextSegmentRenderer
uno.anahata.asi.swing.chat.render.MarkupTextSegmentRenderer
public class MarkupTextSegmentRenderer extends AbstractTextSegmentRenderer
Renders a markdown text segment into a WrappingEditorPane. This class extends AbstractTextSegmentRenderer and handles the conversion of markdown to HTML and applying appropriate styling.
Author:
anahata

  • Constructor Details

    • MarkupTextSegmentRenderer

      public MarkupTextSegmentRenderer(ChatPanel chatPanel, String initialContent, boolean isThought)
      Constructs a new MarkupTextSegmentRenderer.
      Parameters:
      chatPanel - The chat panel instance.
      initialContent - The initial markdown content for this segment.
      isThought - True if the text represents a model thought, false otherwise.

  • Method Details

    • render

      public boolean render()
      Renders or updates the segment's JComponent based on the current content. This method should be called to ensure the component reflects the latest content. It should handle diffing internally to avoid unnecessary re-creation of components. It reuses the existing WrappingEditorPane if available and updates its content only if the markdown text has changed.
      Specified by:
      render in class AbstractTextSegmentRenderer
      Returns:
      True if a visual update occurred, false otherwise.

    • matches

      public boolean matches(TextSegmentDescriptor descriptor)
      Determines if this renderer can handle the given segment descriptor. Subclasses must implement this to specify their compatibility. A MarkupTextSegmentRenderer handles TextSegmentType.TEXT descriptors.
      Specified by:
      matches in class AbstractTextSegmentRenderer
      Parameters:
      descriptor - The TextSegmentDescriptor to check.
      Returns:
      True if this renderer can handle the descriptor, false otherwise.

    • getComponent

      public JComponent getComponent()
      Returns the actual Swing component managed by this renderer.
      Specified by:
      getComponent in class AbstractTextSegmentRenderer
      Returns:
      The JComponent.
